clinicalDescription: Overview: Inflammation that damages the esophagus (mouth to the stomach). Presentation: Painful, difficult swallowing and chest pain with eating. Heartburn, and acid regurgitation. Assessment: Presenting symptoms and history. Esophagitis can be caused by a number of different conditions affecting the digestive system. Tests include: barium xray and endoscopy. Plan: Treatments depend on the cause and severity of damage, can include medications and surgery. Lifestyle changes.Prognosis: Short-term, resolves within days to weeks
